title: Drawing, "Sketches for a palace"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
Watermark: "P I" and ? (RB'45)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Center: an elevation: two obliquely disposed wings flank the central domed section showing a colonnade in its full width. Flights of stairs or ramps lead to it. Several plans are concerned with the idea of wings radiating from a central section. Top left, bottom rights: two views. The dome rises from a side wing.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches for a palace".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1078.
